review: This particular location made me ban Fridays for atleast 3 years because the food and service was awful! Well I decide to give them another try. The spinach dip was a little cold.... But ok. My waiter was the best, she suggested a great drink... Um, Captain Jacks Island fruit punch... Delish! She even chatted a sec about football. My fried shrimp with Jack Daniels sauce was good but no where near the way it used to be years ago. Oh and my shrimp was like popcorn size. LOL Really.....

Visited this location on Saturday to watch the Alabama vs Georgia football game.  Sat at the bar, good view of game from various Televisions.  Atmosphere was great, everyone geared up for their team.  Really crowded, but not too much of a wait for the food. Ordered Beef Craft Burger with Fries which had jalepenos and a spicey mayonaise with guacamole. The Burger was juicy, good flavor.  Also ordered a cocktail Long Island Ice Tea, not really strong. I also sampled some of the Jack Daniels Sampler, ate some Chicken and Shrimp, did not sample the pork. The shrimp was lightly fried decent flavor, the chicken was better with a sweet type sauce glazed over it.  The overall experience was good, Alabama won the game!
Great service. We ate on the patio. Wonderful weather. Listing to the radio station broadcast next door. Food was excellent as well.
Service was very slow!  Waited 30 minutes for my meal.  Order a turkey burger & sweet potato fries!!!  The turkey burger was dry and over cooked. Not impressed at all with the overall service.

J M. wrote on 3/6/2013: "Service was very slow!  Waited 30 minutes for my meal.  Order a turkey burger & sweet potato fries!!!  The turkey burger was dry and over cooked. Not impressed at all with the overall service." ---------------- This review is on 3/30/13 and it is no different than what J M. Wrote.  He was spot on from the very first sentence.  I am a huge fan of T.G.I. Friday's.  In fact, when it comes to those chains: T.G.I. Friday's, Applebees, Chilis, Ruby Tuesdays, etc...Historically T.G.I. Fridays has always been my favorite.  I will not let this particular location change my perspective because  I know there are great locations but the one on Camp Creek SUCKS!   Service is beyond slow as the aforementioned.  As far as the appetizers, they are o.k.  I always loved the mozzarella sticks but it wasn't the best thing in the world.  The mozzarella sticks you can buy from Publix or Kroger out of the box tasted better than that crap!  Ordered the Ribs & Shrimp.  The ribs were COLD!  GTFOH.  Jack Daniel's ribs....cold. Oh hell naw Tommy! #MartinVoice.  That's just the food itself.  My biggest knock is the service.  A)  Sat down in the booth, waited 10 minutes before a service came by to to take order for beverages (let alone food) and then another 10-15 mins just for the drinks to come to the table. Here's my wife's take on her experience as she is sitting right next to me as I type this review as if I'm a stenographer in court :  Wife - "Ok, I thought this was the slowest service I've ever had in 28 years.  It took 30 minutes just to get a damn lemonade drink though it took an hour to get my food.  Though my food was good, it was kind of cold, I was choking on the shrimp while I had to wait another 15 minutes just to get another lemonade.  It took 15 minutes to get a frozen brownie to go.  The most retarded thing I saw was they gave out those reservation slips instead of the buzzer that most restaurants are accustomed to.  You had to listen in like a damn FBI agent just to hear your number called.  Don't waste your time going unless you like to wait 1-2 hours from the time you get there and to the time you leave" I'm back at the helm.  If there is another T.G.I. Fridays within 30 minutes drive from East Point and you are craving, go to that other location for sure.  I know there's a T.G.I. Fridays in Concourse E at Hartsfield-Jackson.  If I have to get a boarding pass just to eat some Jack Daniels ribs, I rather go to that location and waste time at the one on Camp Creek.  I know reviews, this service sucks! Grade: F

Positively abysmal. I went with 2 stars instead of one just because the food was edible. We got a 20% off coupon in the mail, and while we don't normally eat at these types of restaurants, we couldn't resist the bargain. We would live to wish we had resisted. This was the slowest service I've experienced in Atlanta. We had two different servers, so that was confusing. The guy who ended up helping us was obviously working very hard and had tables all over the restaurant. Most of the rest of the staff was milling aimlessly. We were there for 2 hours and not because we were chatting. It took them 20 minutes to deliver a bottle of beer to the table, for God's sake. My burger was decent (NY Cheddar and Bacon with a turkey burger substituted) but it didn't have all of the toppings the menu described. By the time I got it, I was so hungry that I just ate it. Not that anyone was around to complain to, anyway. I was looking the whole time for a manager or someone who I could speak to about how terrible the service was, but no dice. Even my receipt was messed up so I couldn't see if or where they had discounted it 20%. I didn't short the guy on the tip because I felt that it was a management problem.  We will not be back.

Apparently on order to get service here you have to know someone.  I came early on game night along with three others and lucked up and got some seats at the bar.  Well first the bar tender asked us was we staying there and we said we r about to switch seats with these wonderful gentlemen since they had a booth and it was two of them and four of us. She immediately said "S@! T".  Yup thats what she said. Unprofessional moment #1.    Then i heard her tell some old man, we shall call Mr Fridays, I tried to get your attn before they sat down so you can have these seats.  Humm I let it slide. Unprofessional moment #2. Then Mr Friday decides to tell me if I move he is taking my seat and there will b no table/seat switching in there.  We argue for a moment then some other server/bar tender say there is no seat saving in here and thatll b a $25 fee.  Unprofessional moment #3.  He proceeds to tattle to managment while the person who was to be our new server and the bar tender all stood over there taklking about us as if we were not there.  Basically saying they were going to refuse us service bc her little sugar daddy couldn't have my seat. Unprofessional moments #4-10. I wanted to stay and just hold the seats but my friends prefer service so we left.  Lets see if they like the letter to corporate, sounds like a case of discrimination to me.

Maybe it was bcuz it was game night but there service was HORRIBLE no where to sit first off amd when we did sit the waitresses kept WALKING PAST US I was furious I felt as tho they were doing it purposely... I will never return to this location

One star, because no stars is not an option.  This USED to be the only restaurant on Camp Creek I would step foot in, because it WAS the only one not filled with ghetto hood rats working there.  Past: Food was good, good customer service, polite staff/hostess, decent wait time; in general a pleasant experience.  Today: Not sure how the food is (more on that later), dismal customer service, RUDE hostess, atrocious wait times; horrible experience.  We arrived around 11:30 pm and had to ask around to figure where the hostess was. When I expressed, to the hostess, my desire to not sit in the back, near the restrooms (which is apparently zone two, and evidently I should know this) I was assured, in the rudest manner possible, that will "definitely make the wait a lot longer." When our number was called, we returned to her to be seated. She looked at us and just held up a single finger as if to say wait, for what I'm not sure, but her gesture/demeanor was extremely rude.  We were seated just after midnight where Mark, our server, was very nice but obviously very over worked. He took our drink and food order immediately, two waters took 25 minutes to arrive. When five different parties arrived long after us were already eating their food, we decided to give him five more minutes to bring our food before we would leave. We ended up leaving at 1:28 am, having received only two waters, no refills, and no food. That was over an hour after we had ordered without a single apology or explanation for the wait, in fact I think we only saw our server 2-3 times.  It is obvious that management at this location either doesn't have the balls or the knowledge to run this place effectively. With the number of patrons who frequent this establishment (I used to be one of them), corporate better find new management before all of these customers, shelling out good money for no good results, wise up and find somewhere else to go, I know I'm looking. Also, the longer this goes on, the harder it will be to change the mentality of the employees who have learned, falsely, that their blatant disrespect toward customers is acceptable.

Let me tell ya'll something.  Here it is:  Jack Daniels sauce.  As long as it is slathered on something I'll eat it.  They hit the jackpot with that sauce.  So I decided to stop at Friday's for some lunch.   I ordered the JD's chicken sandwich.  That thing was so on point, I can't even talk about it.  Okay, yes I can.  Grilled chicken cooked with the JD sauce, fried Cajun onion rings on the sandwich, lettuce, tomato, and BACON and cheese (please note the ingredients absolutely were not listed in any particular order of goodness).  That sandwich was bangin folks.  You need to try it.  I had to go to the bathroom to wash my hands after the meal because it got real at that table.   I'm gonna calm down now.  The service was good.  The nice lady was attentive and very kind.  Friday's is a chain, which you already know and I think the food beats out Applebee's and Chilli's.  I'm gonna give them 3.75 stars.   Sign up for their online program called Stripes and go ahead and get yourself a free appetizer.  Moreover, you earn points every time you dine with them. Get on it.   As I've said, the sandwich was great, but I want it to cost less than $9 and some change at lunch time.  If you get the burger prepare for over $10 on that one.  Too much.  Yet, I'll be back because Jack's got me wide open.

So boo and I came here on a Saturday night to watch the Final Four. This TGI Friday's is one of the few left in the area. The next closest one is the airport and we all know you can't just post up in the airport. Anyhoo...the wait was ridiculous, which was to be expected for anything on the Camp Creek corridor. We realized that people were just sitting themselves in the bar area, including the tables around it. Luckily a manager walked by and said "hey you guys have been here for a while, take a seat here." #winning We ordered off of the 2 for $10 special they had going on and some drinks. Yall know that jack daniels sauce is fie (fire) right? My boyfriend had never had it and was in his own small piece of heaven. I was just about to leave our waitress a large tip because the runner mistakenly brought out boo the wrong food plate (he got a plate that should have cost him 10 more dollars for half that price) until she spilled ice cold water on me and my phone. Keep in mind it was like 45 degrees outside and she really didn't help me clean it up either...*cries*. I still tipped her because overall her service was good and that's just what you do...these people are making $2.13 an hour guys. Been there, done that, not pleasant when you work your butt off and the people don't tip. Urm. I don't come here often but if I have a random craving for a JD burger I'll be here with all the crowds.

Despite seemingly slow lunch crowd it took awhile to get greeted after were seated. My wife ordered an app as her meal while I ordered a lunch special. We made it clear the app was her meal. They brought her food out a full 10 minutes before mine. No one got that that was wrong. Then my food.. A BLT and salad. The BLT was awful. Very little bacon one strip torn in 2 placed on lettuce tomato and avacado on a half stale Italian roll very very lightly toasted . The bread had no butter and the bread had not been browned. A bad execution of a simple sandwich. The fries were stale and cold. Overall a bad experience but one that is par for the course for restaurants in this area.

This is "my" Fridays, it's close by my house and it's one of my go to spots.  First the good. .. I've never had subpar food or drink here ever. I mean this is Fridays so don't come here expecting top of the line doing. It is what it is. I highly recommend the Jack Daniels menu, that JD burger is FiYA!!!!! (That means good) Appetizers are a can't miss and I personally love the garlic parmesan wings. I've never had a problem with the bartenders and they've always been good and made my drinks decent. On certain nights they have a DJ and if you can get there before it gets crowded they usually get it poppin. The cons: Because of the location the place can get really crowded. It's good for business but for events like football, basketball or anything special event get there early or don't complain when you have to wait cause it does get crowded.  Like I said this has been a pretty reliable spot and I thoroughly enjoy it.

I enjoyed this restaurant. I visited with my daughter for my birthday, and we had a really nice time. I had a beer, and she had a smoothie. We ordered an appetizer, our food and dessert. Our server didn't rush us and let us take our time going through each course. The manager stopped by several times to make sure everything was OK. I really like this place, so we will return.

Went to this location last minute...it was late on a Saturday night and my friend was "starving" I don't remember the waitresses name but I'm not sure she even told us. She sucked to say the least...when the food finally arrived, we didn't have any utensils.  We had to hunt the waitress down to get water, napkins and a fork? Yes it was late (11:30-midnight) and yes it was crowded but can we get the basics to enjoy our meal? They get 3 stars:  2 for hot food and one for the waitress and waiter that served us since our designated waitress didn't

To start server was 2 cool . He actually came and sat down with me in my family to take order didn't bother writing it down he is so cool. Brought drinks horrible ordered some kinda of lemonade with a kids sprite . Sprite tasted like tonic water , lemonades more like waterade . Food finally arrived 45 mins later crazy part was seated right by the kitchen so we could hear every order that was called . Back 2 food sorry was not satisfied my food wasnt good at all extra cripau shrimp near burned,  ribs lack of heat as if ot was sitting under the light for 20 mins . Mr cool put in wrong order for my girl so they broughy the wrong food . By this time im done eating so now I have 2 wait on them 2 bring her food . Daughter didn't complain she's only 4 lol . So was just a bad experience all the way around so I asked mr cool the waiter I'm sure we get a discount o I took it off yeah the messed up order u brought why would we pay for that ? But was still charged for the extra wait of having to wait on them to correct their error. After I was done eating now me in my daughter have to wait on her mother to eat because the waiter was so cool he put in the wrong order to begin with. Don't  waste your time @ this establishment.
Came here to watch a football game. Our waitress was very nice and the food was good, as usual for a Friday's restaurant. Good place to grab a quick bite.

I went in with expectations of this being a usual camp creek spot. BUT I'm glad to say I was wrong. Some of my friends and I went and sat at the bar to have a few drinks and to eat Erica (the bartender), I think that's her name, was very pleasant. She introduced herself with a smile and also let us know what the drink special was. I ordered a Hurricane and it was very delicious. I also ordered the boneless wing. The wings were very wet and favorable. My overall experience was good. We stayed until they closed and not once did the employees show that they were agitated by us being there so late. Maybe there is a decent spot to finally go to to have drinks at night :)
Waiting 25-30 min because I have a child and there e empty tables by the bar. Terrible customer service on that

Football, appetizers and bar food should be easy... It all makes sense.  Not here. At Friday's its always Slow. After much coercion,  I was recommended to come back by Cedric who was a brand new manager at the time. I have been back a couple times since the horrific first experience. Those experiences where hit or miss. This time is a definite confirmation I won't be back. Long story short. Bartender was over worked and lacked in service.  Had to ask about my 25 minute Spinach dip and wings which obviously sat in the window forever due to the fact of hot celery and old ranch. . They retossed the wings in sauce which were barely luke warm. Never got a check back what so ever.  Still haven't as I am writing this. The barback relayed the rest of our order to him. Guess he was too busy for that 2 bite check back. I started with water since I was famished.  No one offered a drink to me. Why should I have to flag you down for everything.  I definitely won't put myself through the agony again.  The next time I will care about a Friday, is due to a work week.
Extremely loud music ! You can't even hear the server talking to you ! Way to loud to enjoy a meal or even be able to talk to anyone ! If I wasn't hungry I would have left !

This was a waste of money the service was good but the food was horrible my steak was nasty the ribs was burnt the pasta was undercooked I really want my money back I think I should call the restaurant and ask

Service was horrible stopped by for a quick lunch...waiter took half of my order and walked away...had to flag down another waiter to complete it...food was absolutely horrible....I will not come back!
Small crowd Monday evening.  Sat at the bar---drinks were good...food was the same...service was extremely good

I've never had a prob. w/any of the TGIFriday's that I've patronized. I went here yesterday(4-12-15), w/ my boyfriend and his son, around 5:00 and it was CROWDED, but we only had to wait about 20 mins. to be seated. Our waitress, Destinee was very pleasant, and efficient! Our food came out in a reasonable time frame and it was very tasty! I had the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken Pasta, my bf had the pick 3 platter and his son had a Bacon Burger. The food was DE-LISH!!! I can't wait to go back so I can redeem my Stripes for a free entree'!! YAAYYY!!

Its obvious a lot of employees like to flirt and talk.  Others are steadily bringing out food taking care of a lot of tables with zero assistance from fellow employees.  Hit and miss getting decent wait staff.  Fortunately, for us, we lucked out and

Horrible service! We sat ourselves at the bar since we were barely greeted at the door. Once seated no one paid attention to us for about 10 mins. Finally I was able to get someone's attention and the basically just put the menus on the table and walked away. We had to flag her down just to order . We ordered and it took 30 mins to get our drinks. It was not busy only about 8 people sitting at the bar. Our bartender was just walking around and a lady sitting next to us even noticed how long it was taking. We asked for the manager but he didn't seem too concerned with the actions of his employee. She was extremely defensive and attempted to address our complaint with us as we ate. Very horrible service! Everytime I come into this location the service is not like other T.G.I Friday's.

Terrible service tonight!!! If I could give ZERO stars... I would!!! Will never ever go back there. The manager was incompetent and uncaring. The waitstaff seem overwhelmed by the chaos that is their operations. The manager wasn't leading and was thrown under the bus by our waiter and other waitstaff. They got my order wrong, an hour later, it wasn't corrected. My fiancee got to eat her entire meal and felt bad that my night ended up in a McDonald's drive thru. I just wanted to take my boo out to eat... well she got to eat... anyways. Uncaring, insincere, grossly underwhelming... a very poor representative of the TGIF franchise. Never ever again.  We drove 30 minutes from Villa Rica and this is what I got? At the end, the cowardly manager ducked us and didn't even offer us a break. Then they wanted to charge me for the steak and ask me if I wanted it to go. F!@k you!!! I came to your restaurant, within operating hours, to sit and eat a steak...not take it home!!! Well... needless to say... we are never ever going back. We overheard 2 waitresses apologizing to their respective tables about how bad the management and kitchen are. Not just THAT NIGHT...but every night!!! I'm all set!!! Bye Felicia!!!
Kat is the best bartender here! Food was great! Atmosphere  was good and the service  was impeccable!
Great spot ..... Love the service love the food... I would recommend the spot.... Great ambiance...

Pretty bad all around, but one or two bright spots. Went here on bike night, Carla was our waitress. We sat there at the bar waiting for a while because some of the bar staff didn't understand how to queue people who had been sitting there first. Whoever yelled loudest gets a drink. My brother and I ordered two long islands. Carla made them correctly the first time. Ordered another one by Erin; tasted weak and was half as full as the ones Carla made. No consistency in serving size. Sat there for a while and decided to order food. Went for two unlimited boneless wing orders. First off, do not order this. The first set of Jack Daniels came out hot for me, but half of then we're hard as rocks. Did not complain because they were supposedly unlimited. My brother's buffalo was cold like they has been ordered by someone else and left out. He asked for another set, or even for them to warm those up. At that time, I ordered another set of Jack Daniels since those were gone in three minutes. Waited 45 minutes for them to bring out my brother's next set. Another 15 before I just cancelled my next set - even though they were 'on the way'  An hour in between servings of an 'unlimited' wing order is ridiculous. I told them to just take off one and we'd leave. Possibly they need to have the woman propping up the door replaced with a rock and have her in the back cooking. At least the bar's service was decent, the drinks and food we received was edible and the place is clean, so they get three stars for that.

We had to wait almost ten minutes for service . However the waiter was very nice and honest. I first wanted to Try the mahi mahi but he said indirectly that I would be unsatisfied so I opted for the jack Daniels chicken and shrimp with Mac and cheese and spinach and it was so good I got one for home . Also the crown royal cooler was very good and the apple slice was fresh! Our waiter was very nice and gay friendly unlike some male waiter are to me so I applaud him for the gratitude .

Our terrible experience lasted 2 hours. It took over an hour to get our food and she never refilled our glasses during this period or at all through the entire visit. The food was cold when it arrived. It took us over 30 minutes to get our checks and then they were messed up also. The waitress had an attitude when we questioned about our food. We had to go to 3 different servers to chase down our checks. No one was apologetic for their terrible service. Not a place I recommend to anyone. The worst service I have had in a long time.
The service is terrible. The servers are so slow and act like you aren't even there. Won't be going back there again.

Servers are pretty horrible and not knowledgable. Also they're on the lazy side. If you're a Stripes Reward Member make sure you redeem your points immediately. It seems as if some of the staff keeps the signed receipts and uses the points before you can add them. I had to call guest relations to fight and get credit for my visit.

Please don't waste your time here... Service is VERY slow, food is the poorest quality I've seen. I even gave the spirits a try and was highly disappointed. I'm confused as to how is the place still in business. Definitely not a good look for the TgiFriday chain. Waste your time at your own risk, but you'll definitely leave disappointed.

After our first interaction with this TGIFRIDAYS, The only reason why we would come back is because of one bartender and the Jack Daniels sauce. This place was PACKED, which I figured it would be, so I called ahead and asked to make reservations. Someone explain to me a restaurant that doesn't take reservations? Especially on the weekend? And told us it's a 15 minute wait. Considering how this is one of the few restaurants in the middle of booty-toot nowhere and we had a movie to see and ALL other restaurants around it had at least a 45 minute wait, we came. Hood rats united here, I even saw a Cadillac with hydraulics come to find some parking. Hoochie outfits and a verbal cat fight out in the parking lot.  Inside, there was some woman with a bad attitude  writing down people's names on a sheet of paper. We were waiting for over an hour after she took our names. So obviously there is no actual system, computer or otherwise, here. The busboys weren't cleaning the tables, people left and those tables stayed dirty for 15+ minutes. Um, where's the management? You don't see this line out the door?   While people who came in after us were getting tables and we were about to leave, a bartender actually came and grabbed us, saying there was plenty of room at the bar. And there was plenty of room, why didn't the hostess ask anyone if we wanted to sit at the bar? Anyway, the bartender we had I believe was Joseph? If not, he was tall, dark skinned, and very funny.  The food is mediocre for the price, but the drinks (and the bartender's entertainment) were very good. I guess the cooks (and the corporation) think they can get away with so-so food as long as it's slathered in Jack Daniels sauce. Let's face it, the sauce is tasty. If we are ever around there again and are hungry and really have a time constraint and the other restaurants have long wait lines...then we'll sidestep the hostess and go straight to the bar.

I'm actually writing this review while in the so called establishment. After waiting for 30 minutes to be seated (which I was advised of the wait) and another 20 min for our food to be served, all for there to be a chipped piece of plate in my food. The waitress took the food back, but now my party is done eatin, while I'm waiting for another plate to be served (an additional 20 min). When I asked the manager, Fred Brown, to discount my meal he looked at me as if I was speaking another language. I find it absolutely absurd for him to be in the customer service business. So for everyone that will continue to frequent this TGI Friday, if you notice a piece of glass in your food...bite it. I say that because it appears that they would prefer to pay a lawsuit rather than discount a $13 meal.

Went in and was sat in the booths close to the kitchen....... ROACHES!!!!! in the seams of the booths. Alive and running so they still had life in them. Told the waitress Cancel the order I gotta go. And I have a mess of stripes too.....

This visit was for the exact same phone but during a quick lunch with my parents. Our waitress, whose name we quickly forgot, seemed tired. Our silverware was disgusting. There was food on our silverware so we asked for plastic. The first round of endless apps was delicious..didn't take too long. Second round was alright but my mothers glass was replaced with a new drink and had something gross out the outside. The entire time the waitress has been darting off and different staff is bringing us our food. There were times when..we were waiting for food and couldn't recall what items. Towards the end we hadn't seen our waitress and after waiting 10mins for just my dads plate i asked for a to go drink and a box. I was then told i couldnt do that. I said why not? I was told that its because it's dine in only. Mind you i waited for my dads food and by then we were all ready to go. I get the drink but no ticket or the box. The waitress comes back to repeat what was said with much attitude.  I wasn't going to but decided to ask for the manager. She walks over and also says its dine in only. If you look at my previous review ive got a box each time. Consistency is inportant.  And service.  Needless to say i boxed my food.

This is only my second time coming here. I chose to sit at the bar because I was alone. I walked it was not greeted. Sat at the bar for mins. Had to ask the bartender to wipe it clean. She took her time because she was having a conversation with someone. Then after asking her to wipe it clean. I still did not get a menu. I then waited again and another bartender asked me if I had been helped I told her no. I asked for a ice water and she gave me a menu. Waited again and still no water or no one has came back to ask me my order. I had waited 15 mins til after all of these to finally order with a guy bartender who took my order.  Still no silverware no refills on water. They were all too busy having personal conversations with guess.  Even the people next to me couldn't believe how bad my service was. I got my food and left right after eating.  I saw that the reviews were horrible but I gave it a chance and boy was that wrong. I should of went to somewhere else. I will never go back to this location.  The people next me said they had problems with getting there drinks and took 45 mins for there food. I even had the Manager come over and talk to the lady next me and didn't even notice I wasn't eating because they never gave me silverware. Out of 5 people behind the bar you would think you would get better service. The BBQ flat bread was okay . Never again .

This had to be a joke. 99% sure our waitress was high, I could smell it on her and she was so slow and confused by everything. Said they didn't do anything for birthdays so we wanted to use our points to get a free dessert. Got the check for endless appetizers and all the appetizers were charged separately. We were told this was because of adding the points for the dessert. Someone with an ounce of common sense would know we wouldn't want to do that then. Every second of this visit was such a struggle.

I have not been to a T.G.I.Friday's in forever, and even then, it was the Morrow location when I was in college, I'm certain. We ended up at the Camp Creek location on Easter Sunday because we overlooked making lunch plans after church. Our first few choices (more quick and convenient) were all closed, so by default, we ended up there with our nine children and a 45 minute wait. First of all, I told them they didn't have to push tables together, just asked to seat us in the same area, and they still managed to push tables together for us. When we added a guest, making our total 12 people, they didn't bat an eye. They checked in with us at least three times, with a smile, assuring us they had an area ready for us as soon as the last guest sitting over there was finished eating. They seated us in about 30 minutes and we had the most pleasant waitress, Adrianna, who took our order right away. If she was mad about working on Easter, you wouldn't have guessed it. She was perky and friendly and even got on the same level as the kids as they ordered. She commended their ability to order quickly and noted that tables of twelve adults didn't order as clearly and quickly as they did. Even with kids shuffling around while the order was being prepared, she remembered everyone's meal once it came out. The food was fairly quick, for a busy holiday AND Sunday lunch, and it was all hot and delicious (except the salad, which was cold, of course). ;-) There was also a staff member walking around the tables and asking parents if he could share a piece of Easter candy with the kids. We had the best experience today! While the restaurant chain itself has never been a preferred choice of ours, our local representative has made us want to visit their again. :-)

This place is always fun. Food is good. Management is great. Drinks are good. This location has a lot of events that drum up a great crowd. I frequent this location. I love quite a few dishes on the menu. My favorite is the Cobb salad. Managers always engage the customers to make sure everything is going well. This is appreciated.

I think i like the service better than the food for this location. Served cold and over cooked food. Not to mention misleading advertising . I had a coupon for buy one entrée and get another free when you buy 2 drinks. So because I also ordered an appetitizer, they considered that for  the free entrée and NOT one of my meals....

Where to start. The service here is absolutely horrible!  A coworker and I came in for supper. The hostess made eye contact with us, and I told her 2 of us. She looked at us like we were from another planet!  She mumbled something to another lady standing there, who immediately shrugged her shoulders and walked away. She then rolled her eyes and motioned towards the bar seating area.  She put menus down on the table and walked away. We sat for 10 minutes and no one even acknowledged us. With 2 bartenders watching, I walked up to the bar to get us a couple of drinks. Both bartenders immediately turned their back to me and began chatting with a couple of people on the other side of the bar. Mind you, there were only 5 people at the bar at this time. One of the bartenders finally walked up and asked what I wanted.  I got our drinks and returned to our table where continued to wait for another 10 minutes for our waiter.  We finally ordered and 20 minutes later got our food.  It was okay.  Not great, not horrible.  Definitely will not return to this place when I'm back in Atlanta.

I keep trying to give this location a shot. I will say I've had good service maybe twice in coming to this establishment. It's never my choice to come here. Today pretty much killed coming here again. Our waitress was terrible.  People with the same waitress got their food before us as we watched. Given no reason or apology to why this occurred. Had to hunt her down for anything but she sure moved fast with the check. It would've been better to order to go and sat on our back deck with the food. It's a bad sign when other patrons are complaining loudly. Oh, let me mention the food, it was edible,  lukewarm and tasteless.
They need to seriously clean this place.  There a fruit flies all over the bar area.  The service is okay.  Nothing major.  The proces are out of control though.  An entree for $20 @ Fridays?  Naa.

Everything seemed to be going great! We had someone there early to get on the list for a table...yaaay  We were there for the live music by "gritz & jelly butter" so yaaay we are about to sit down & order food & enjoy tonight! As we kept walking we noticed families with kids...& then "dunh dunh duuunh" the hostess points at our table which is literally next to the kitchen in the back. No band, no grownups....uuuum So we discussed it amongst ourselves about possibly sitting on the open patio or even the open tables near the front...we asked & the answer to both "these aren't open" meaning no wait staff to cover.  So THEN we continue to stand at the front hoping that the, so far, friendly staff will find us an awesome solution. Nope....they started literally looking over us seating other parties...and talking slick about "people getting on their nerves" my guess, alluding to us.  So at some point we were almost seated at someone else's table....which was our queue to exit the premises. I'm already not a fan of chain restaurants but this was cray cray...& another great example of wonderful customer service!! Sorry gritz & jelly butter we'll catch u somewhere else!

After living in this neighborhood for almost ten years, I finally ventured into this location.  We went during the day on a Friday about 3pm for a friends birthday lunch and even then there was about a 15 min wait to be sat.  Another thing that made us decided to go in was they sent a coupon for the month of April, May and June, long story short its 3 uses per month, were you can either get 20% off your meal or BOGO.  We went with the 20% off and still came up with a $53 tab. Our server was nice, but once she brought out the food, we didn`t see her again until we were ready to pay the check. I had the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich, and while I thought my bacon could have cooked a little longer, it was by far one of the best chicken sandwiches I`ve eaten at a chain restaurant.  I almost keeled over when she quoted a price of $12 for a glass of sangria, but went with it anyways, and was really disappointed.  My lunch companion spent $10 on one shot of Hennessy, it had more kick than the sangria.  I ended up ordering a shot of Honey Jack after gluping down the sangria, and that was $9 Save your money and don`t order the cheese sticks.  Out of the four or five cheese sticks that came with the order,  they were mostly bread with about an inch of cheese in the middle of the `stick` Anything that has the Jack Daniels sauce, go with it.  The rest of it is just standard chain restaurant food.

Worst service ever - waited forever for our waitress to even come over to get our drink order, waited a long time for the food to come out (it was good and hot though), but I had no silverware - had to ask 2 people and still took 5 minutes to get it. After we were finally able to flag someone down to pay the bill we never even got an itemized receipt. Awful experience, but the food was good.
like the wings very much. they must have a lot of lemon juice in their recipe! Hot is spicy enough for normal people. Dont try super spicy~

My friend and I ordered the nacho appetizer and the One-Two punch drink. We were satisfied with our order and our server Wallace was awesome!!  He came to check up on us throughout and everything went well. I came here often when this place first opened and they could definitely use a deep clean and some new menus (ours were soooo old and gross and my booth chair was taped).
Outstanding service even on one of the busiest nights.  Food was especially outstanding. I just love the fried green beans.

Just had the best lunch that I have had all week!! Ordered Spinach Florentine Flatbread which is topped with spinach, artichoke heart, monterey jack, parmesan and romano cheeses, tomatoes, garlic, oregano and crushed red peppers. Now I omitted the peppers but the only slight complaint that I guess I would give is a took a bite of an extremely large chunk of garlic. For $9 dollars the portion was on point so much that I will be having the rest for dinner.  Parking was ample and for it to be 1pm they did not seem to be extremely busy. This location is located in a plaza with several other restaurants surrounding it.  The to go guy was polite and fast so he really deserved his tip. Although I don't frequent chain establishments I can see lunch here again maybe before the year is out since I am not disappointed.

So I just left this place after placing a to go order and disappointed would be an understatement. First issue was my order online included 2 Perrier waters. Of course when I get to the restaurant they tell me that they don't have Perrier. Ok no big deal. But I also ordered a Jack Daniels burger but did not get the Jack Daniels sauce to go with it so I turned back around after leaving the restaurant to get it-no problem because the sauce is worth it. But THEN when I get home to eat the Parmesan crusted chicken that I ordered, the chicken is so tough that I could barely cut it, let alone chew it. It will be a longgggggg time before I come back to this place. This is the #1 reason why I cook as much as possible because I hate spending my money on disappointing food.

I love the Jack Daniels chicken and Shrimp, that Jack Daniel sauce is so good. The food is always Good but this Location never seems to get it right Service always sucks.. No way can I ever go back to this location.

I can honestly say that TGI Fridays is the worst franchise anywhere in the country and I've been to many. Unprofessional host, 20 minutes to wait for someone to clean up the booth for us to be seated and then another 20 minutes for server to come to the table. Side note after 20 minutes we left.  I love their food and drinks but why should I spend money at an establishment that has so little regard for their customer. I received better service at McDonalds.

Horrible experience!! Will NOT be returning. A coworker reserved a party of 20-25 at 7:30 pm for 19 year old daughter birthday. It's currently 9pm & we are just now getting seated. Tables are dirty. Half the party is seated while the other half is waiting for tables to be cleaned. We heard every excuse why seating wasn't available such as "we weren't aware of the party, we had tour buses, the vice president of the restaurant is sitting in the section that was for you." Remind you all this this was communicated through a "shift leader."  They even had the audacity to suggest that the party sit outside with one server to make up for not having a section available. Really? It's 65 degree outside & temp is dropping. Cocoa, Chris, & Mike, the mangers avoided proper communication as much as possible. The managers were not hands on whatsoever. Didn't assist with getting drinks, cleaning tables, etc. I will give kudos to Byron, the waiter.  He held down the the team as much possible. Shame on the the vice president of the restaurant if that truly was him enjoying his meal with family in the mist of the chaos of his establishment. I only hope he will address the issue behind closed doors. Not to mention they are still trying to charge a 18% gratuity, even though the party was broken into small groups & different waiters. It's 9:30 have yet to place a food order. I would have been left if I wasn't for supporting a young lady on her birthday. Let me reemphasize will not be returning.

I ate at Fridays with my girlfriend.  The French Dip sandwich was not good.  The potstickers and the meatballs were tasty however.  The service staff were angry because it was busy and they couldn't manage the volume of guests.

I can not believe what happened to our group on Sunday 2/12/17 when we dined at TGI Fridays on Campcreek Pkwy in East Point, GA!!!  We were SCAMMED/ROBBED by the mgr warren brown on our bill!!  I would suggest that no one goes to this restaurant or you better double check your bill and be ready to wait it out to get your bill correct!!!  My party was tired of waiting to get the bill corrected and paid the bill when mr warren brown instead of correcting the bill mr brown just took off the waitress' tip which was $32+.  We were celebrating my brother's birthday 69 years old!  So they wanted to pay the bill and tip the waitress in cash.  So we were SCAMMED/ROBBED out of $45 at least!!  We had 2 checks that totaled over $300!  I've contacted TGI Fridays' customer service 4 times since 2/13 and was supposed to hear back from a regional or district mgr but I haven't heard from anyone as of today 3/7!  On top of this, the food was staggered and brought very late to some of our party and we had to correct some of the food orders!

Don't go here. The are a number of restaurants around camp creek that are great THIS TGIF is not worth it. The promotions don't apply here, and they are slower than slow. If you want a good night, I suggest you go anywhere else.

Awful. Ordered takeout and was on hold twice for about 15 minutes. I should've trusted my instincts to order with someone else. My mistake. Then, manager said he would put an order in   himself. Came in waited for 15 minutes to get an order they now can't even find. 3 waitresses and still can't find it. Waste of time. They are extremely disorganized. Come only if you gave a ton of patience and don't require halfway decent service.  Awful.

Decided to come in on a Sun afternoon.  What a mistake.  The servers seemed swamped with tables and the food was being rushed out of the kitchen to meet the demand.  My fiancé and I ordered the endless apps and were given the small "additional app" plate as our first appetizer instead of the usual larger plate. Also when our apps arrived they were on the verge of being undercooked. When we asked if we could order more than one appetizer at a time, our request was denied.  So we were forced to wait  until we received our small plates to order more. I would have preferred to wait longer for a table instead of my food being rushed out of the kitchen to meet the high demand.

Obviously this place does a massive amount of volume.   It is always packed.  It is typical of the Southside with attitude service and it is probably not the employees fault it is a ownership management issue.   If you don't know any better you won't do any better.   Paper towel dispenser in mens room was in operable and mounted in a bad place.  I will not go into details of what happened.   It is just clear that the business needs more attention in attitude, cleanliness, and most of all professionalism.  I give this review with 4 visits or more and it is not getting better.
I enjoyed my visit. Services was amazing. My waitress was the best. The food was great. It was ordered and received in great timimg. My drink was just right. I will be back.

Lawdddd the worst customer service ever! That's why I rather frequent the Kennesaw location. These people including management need to find a job that has nothing to do with customer service. I understand the crowd this location draw but you know this before taking the job. They Stopped serving food at 10:30 although the host said they stop at 11. Then the waitstaff had an attitude. When I served my attitude was great....why because you depend on tips!

Wise mistake of my life. I went to pick up a steak last night. No one told me it was V103 Biker Night. The parking lot was loaded. I had to park at Chili's to get access to the building. The hostess asked me my name and just waked off. When she came back she advised me, "she's on her way!" Another girl arrived with my food and just placed it on the counter and said "sign!" Worse service ever. However, the food was amazinggggg.

One of the worst dining experiences ever. I went with my fiancé on a Saturday night, and the hostess was already incredibly unfriendly and waved us away with "I'll call you when we're ready". Then after we're seated, a DJ arrives and starts playing music loud enough to shake the entire restaurant. I wasn't aware of there being any kind of event that night, but it was headache inducing. I had to repeat my order to my waiter 4 times, and when I tried getting his attention as he walked RIGHT BESIDE ME, he was completely incapable of hearing me. Of course it's not the server's fault, but the establishment needs to make it well known when there's going to be a performance like this, as this didn't fit the casual laid back service we were hoping for. It was extremely rowdy and unenjoyable. If I wanted to go to a club, I would've.

This restaurant is horrible!!! We waited entirely to long for food. The waiter was very nonchalant. I asked for a straw and it took 37min for the waiter to realize I didn't have a straw. And guess what??!! He still forgot it. I had to walk to the bar and get it myself. I ordered a drink and received the wrong one. The waiter completely forgot about my correct drink. My friend ordered the chicken and shrimp with broccoli. The broccoli came out 28min later!!! I ordered a side of shrimp my food. The shrimp came out fried extra hard and pretty much crumbled when you bit into it. with The silverware was filthy. We had to eventually ask for a cup of hot water to clean out silverware. The manager didn't seem concerned after we made her aware of what was going on. She didn't replace the crispy shrimp and she didn't seem to care that the service was horrible. We attend Fridays regularly but needless to say we won't be back to this one!! If I could give them 0 stars I would!! The service was unacceptable!!

Back at it again. Always jam packed, a young lady greeted me and I ordered food to go. Waited on the patio area. This is extremely ghetto and a last resort for food in the area. I saw a waitress with cornrows walk out the door with her arm being held by another employee. She literally said and I quote "nah bruh cause that sh-t is lame as f-ck". It was in front of at least 10 customers. Then a man drove by in a Black car she said "30 minutes".  Stay off Camp Creek in any of these businesses. I will drive out of the way for better service, professionalism and quality. At least my ribs will taste good. I'm starving, the only reason they got 2-stars

Worse experience ever!!! bad server, he suggested we not get the endless appitizers when that's one of their biggest advertisements. My sister had shrimp in her marinara sauce and no one at the table had shrimp which my sister is highly allergic to seafood. The managers excuse was all the food is fried in the same grease. The point was the shrimp was on the marinara sauce not about the food being fried together. The server rushed us from the table asked my aunt if she wanted him to remove her dirty plate while she was eating. Lastly Aaron Bickerstaff I want to know why my $32.27 Bill turned into a $106.27 charge on my card after you cancelled the transaction. I've tried being nice contacting the manager and the 800 # customer serve sucks it sound like a 12 year old Indian repeating himself during the whole conversation. They never answer the phone at the store. But to run charges without my authorization is a crime. Nothing good comes to people being ugly I dont want to show up to your job with the police for answers but if that's the route I have to take...... I wouldn't suggest anyone to visit that restaurant!!!

Took thee family here for lunch.  One guest order appetizer of sliders.  Didnt get the appetizer until entree was brought to the table.  I personally order my ribeye medium.   The steak came well done.  One of the worst pieces of shoe leather I have ever tried to eat   the only piece that was medium was a end tip piece.  Sever never asked if food was cooked to our liking   Manager walked by didnt asked how the meal was even with the dissappointed looks on our faces!   It will be awhile before I dine here again    I'll drive to douglasville and go to logans steakhouse instead!!

My recent experience here was not pleasant. Came here with my family a few days ago in the late afternoon and was seated apparently in an area that didn't have a server on the clock until 6pm. We waited for about 15-20 min just for someone to acknowledge us... it took another 10 minutes just to have our drinks served. Also, when my family and I seated, the table was dirty with dried up broccoli, yuck. After ordering our food, it took about another 30 min to be served our meal. The server was not attentive at all. The area I was sitting was not her area but she took our table anyways, but it was hard to get her attention, she never refilled our drinks, and complained and continued to remind us that our table was not her area... she wasn't rude, just complained about what she couldn't control which was having to serve my table due to a communication error with the hosts who seated us in the first place. Also, the restroom was absolutely sick and disgusting. None of the stalls has toilet paper, there was crap on the floor, and smelled so bad. I've been to Atlanta multiple times and have eaten at several different restaurants. By far, this was the worst Friday's I have ever been to. I will never go here again due to the lack of customer service and tidiness. I would have rather eaten at McDonald's and called it a night.

If you are not sitting at the bar then you probably will have a bad experience.  For whatever reason it takes 10 minutes to be seated when the place is empty.  This used to be a nice looking place now it looks dingy.

Fun cheap spot for a Saturday night . Staff was very friendly the wait which seemed like it was going to be awhile turned into 15 mins and we were sat in the bar area. Apps were good (sampler) and my boyfriend and I both ordered the Cajun chicken and shrimp tossed in jack Daniels sauce. So good!! The hostess was very busy but polite, a Dj arrived at 9 p and it really picked up the mood of staff and customers. Drinks were ok maybe I'll stick to top shelf but overall good experience . FYI this is fridays not houstons lol for those who are so harsh!

This location is pretty awful. The food and the service are always subpar. We ordered a Friday's combo- potato skins, mozzarella sticks and boneless wings to go. The food was thrown around obviously before we even got it to car. The potato skins- a Friday's signature item, were unacceptable, I've had better from my grocers freezer.

Seated right when I walked in. But then I waited and waited for someone to take my drink order and no one came. I got up and left. So sad because I love TGIFridays but this one sucks! Don't go here find another one if you have to have it.

Went in with a large party and they told us that the tables were ready but we could not be seated because the server was running late. We had already been waiting over 30 mins. We eventually had to be serviced by the manager. We didn't receive enough menus so we had to share. The menus were sticky and missing pages. If the menu did have all the pages, they were falling out of the book. The drinks don't have prices on them and when we asked the manager, they did not know either. I ordered a drink that was advertised but they didn't have it. The food is subpar and the service and atmosphere isnt any better.

Came in and asked to speak to the manager after the hostess told me that they did NOT have a waiter for the patio area in the SUMMER! The hostess who was nice but unfortunately works under bad leadership said the restaraunt is low on wait staff. Not sure why the manager has not hired new wait staff yet, speaking of the manager. As soon as he saw me his face looked pained, like how are you the manager and you looked pained to talk to someone!! Anyway, so I asked him why he did not have a waiter for the patio area and he said you can order at the bar and take the food outside and eat at the patio area, but who should have to do that at a restaraunt. Then I asked who is the Franchisee because I would like to speak to someone to rectify this because this is unacceptable(because it is) And he looked even more pained, and was like he is gonna get me the info and to take a seat. So my mom and I take a seat, then we see two ladies leaving and one said I need to talk to the manager and I asked the other lady what happened and she said the waiter waited on people who came after them first and they said they were going to Red Lobster instead. After that we got up and left and said we would meet them there. So my mom and I go to Red Lobster and we walk in and there is no hostess and ppl are sitting down in the front(I guess waiting to be seated) and we wait a good min and no hostess comes up so we leave. As we are walking out we run into the ladies from Fridays and we tell them basically Red Lobster sucks ass too regarding service and the restaraunt had an odor too so we were leaving. My mom and I ended up getting Panda Express and eating it in our car- which ended up being the BEST thing we ever did, because we weren't around anyone with a stank attitude and didn't have to tip a bad waiter.  I say all this to say that CAMP CREEK has SO MUCH POTENTIAL but does the bare minimum to get by regarding service at the restaurants up there and a much needed stop light in the middle of the road across from the Chic Fil A and the Wendy's and whats even worse is that the beautiful amazing black people that live over there DO NOTHING ABOUT THIS. WE NEED A TOWN HALL MEETING or to attend a CITY HALL meeting about Camp Creek because the people in this community should not have to leave to go to Midtown or Buckhead to get decent service. Also NO ONE SEEMS HAPPY at ANY of these restaurants but that is because people still go to camp creek to dine in knowing that the restaurants ain't shit! This restaraunt has 2 stars and I don't even think the owner cares. There is NO professionalism at these places and people put up with it. Not me though, I would rather eat in my car then pay to deal with bul shit and a stank manager. This was typed out of frustration so sorry if there are any typos lol. If you know how we can start to rectify Camp Creek Marketplaces below average status please MESSAGE ME. Thank you!

STAY AWAY!!! I have never in my life received this level of terrible customer service from a restaurant. I asked for Kona Golden Ale beer, the waitress told me they had none. Fine. Okay. I ordered a Cobb salad, was told they don't have onion bits that go with the salad. Fine. I'll have the salad without French Onions. I then proceed to order French onion soup. Waitress came back and said they had no French onion soup, in fact they had no soups. What! I asked to speak to the Manager, she told me they in fact had many soups....Manager then came back and said, "We are out of soups boo." Stay away from this Friday's.
If I could give this place a fat ass 0 I would. What can I say that has not already been said. Let's do the list shall we.  1) below average food 2) awful ass service 3)nasty drinks

I went out late nite to grab some food before catching a early morning flight.  While looking for food a apparently wandered into a club, with a real DJ and everything.  Atmosphere was awesome.  Good music.  Waitress service was great.  Food was just okay.  I wont go back for food but maybe for a drink and good music this is the spot.

Came here on a lovely Saturday afternoon because they're the only place nearby with a patio. I never loved their food or drinks but again......patio. We roll up and the patio is about 75% empty, weird for a sunny afternoon but ok, maybe it's our lucky day. We walk inside and see a bunch of people waiting for tables. Weird, maybe they think it's too hot to sit outside? When we approach the host stand the young man says 'Can I help you?' but his tone and posture says 'why are you here ruining my life, please go away.'  I ask if there's room on the patio. "The patio is closed." I ask 'just because?' The answer is "we don't have a server out there."  Well, that's just great. Management didn't expect people to want to sit outside on such a lovely day? So now I scan the surroundings and see about 12 ppl waiting and several empty tables that are dirty. Well, that's all I need to see. We head out and over to Ruby Tuesdays that have a nice couple seats at the bar and their amazing supersize Ruby Relaxer and appetizers. Ahhhhhh.

Ohhhh Fridays. Sometimes I love you, sometimes I cannot stand you. I am lured in by the great drink specials, endless appetizers and stellar rewards program. Then I am met with lackluster service, long waits & no parking & I wonder is it all worth it. More often than not it is. The Jack Daniels sauce on any meat is delish, and lots of combinations in choosing meals plus sides. My go to dish is the sizzling chicken & shrimp, always classic. My last visit I had salmon Caesar salad, which I was happy with. I appreciate them staying open later than the competition, however they could use some technology updates because taking my name on paper for a waitlist is completely dated. Get my number & text me!! If you can squeeze in the bar is a great choice for food plus drink and a good view of all the current sports events going on. This location is busy, they have a DJ some nights, and bike night on Wednesdays during the summer is pure insanity. But I can get at least free dessert or a free burger about every third meal, that I simply cannot ignore. So I'll be back.

Went out to have dinner with my friends and mother. The wait was about 30 minutes in which they sat us a dirty table but the waiter Davon or Javon was pleasant and cleaned it up quickly! It was so cold in there my purse felt like a ice cube so we asked to sit outside on the patio. We ordered drinks and food at the same time as soon as we were moved outside. The food took about 45 minutes in which two of our orders were not prepared how we ask and the other order we we're told that another waiter took it and another would be ready in 4 minutes; in which that was not the truth let's try 20 minutes! By the time it came everyone was done eating there food and I just took it to go and to make it so bad it wasn't right at all! The waiter was very pleasant and apologize several times! He comp all of our food except of two meals so I felt a little better but I would have rather had my food prepared right! I gave it 3 stars bc the waiter was awesome

Food is exceptional of course it's a 50/50 depends on who is your server how quick they get it out and who is cooking. My only issue is the phone, the hostess isn't really up front so it's a hit or miss regarding calling in a to go order.

Haven't been here even though it's right in my backyard. Called and placed an order for a Jack Daniels burger ( medium) with a side of spinach. When I get there the hostess is taking an order over the phone for another party but there's another waitress standing at the station. She says hello and I say I'm there to pick up an order. She points to the other young lady. Ok, so I wait. When she gets off the phone, she confirms the order, takes my payment and goes to get it. When she comes back, she hands me the bag and I notice I don't see my side. When asked I'm told it's in the container with the burger!  Great .  So I get home and sure enough, the container is filled with all the liquid from the spinach and my burger is all soggy.  Furthermore, the burger itself is overcooked. If there was enough thought to put the glaze in a separate container why wouldn't you do the same for a side dish that has liquid in it?!  So disappointed

This is by far one of my favorite casual dining spots. This location in particular ALWAYS has something going on so you will usually have to wait on average about 30 minutes. Wednesday night is Bike Night and they flood the parking lot with their cool bikes. I like looking at them so it doesn't bother me. The earlier you come the better because people tend to lounge around laughing and talking. Friday night has a DJ in the bar area and the music is LOUD. Typically, the bar area is real festive and the dining area is more family friendly. Again, expect to wait. My food has always been consistent but one time my guest had an issue and I don't think it was handled well. The Manager was not apologetic or accommodating at all. A true accident, the server was cleaning the table next to us and dropped a container of ranch and it splashed all over my guest. The manager just wanted to provide a wet wipe only. Unacceptable. They ended up comping his meal but I didn't like that more wasn't offered upfront since their server was at fault. Because I like the atmosphere, I kept my rating at a 4 but I do think they need to take better care of their patrons. Really a 3.5 if it was an option

Please see previous review. The dinning experience  end up well. Started off jacked up but our server was excellent! He made up for the slow service at the beginning! I will return to give TGIF a second chance before condemning  them. Inshallah!

Where do I start....  1. It should NEVER EVER EVERRRRRR take 20 minutes for a server to come to the table and greet you. 2. One should NEVER EVER EVERRRR be dining in a restaurant that has a band so loud that the server can't hear me placing my order. I should NOT here every word he's belting out from across the parking lot..... let alone once I'm inside and seated.  UNLESS YOU KNOW SIGN LANGUAGE, find another location to dine at. I won't even mention the food quality...but let's just say that's where the ONE star cane from.

Me and a friend came here on a Monday night to watch the game and get the endless apps special . Instead of it being $12 dollars as advertised I was charged $16. Also my waiter took so long we only got to enjoy to orders of apps . We're there for the whole duration on the game . He also forgot our last  order. It was a waste of money and time. Very disappointed.

This place is TRASH!! We sat for over an hour well before close  & our food just came out an hour before they close....spoke to the manager on duty who did nothing or came past to check to see if we are okay after the first complaint. No drink refills , no silverware , no straws, NO GOOD SERVICE. Sad part about the entire ordeal is that we ALL WORK IN THE SERVICE INDUSTRY & it took a lot for us to even bring it to their attention. Save your money & drive out your way to another Friday's because they ARE TRASH. P.S. they're were only 3 other tables in his section

This establishment is awful!!!! The service is extremely slow. No customer service. On top of all this my bill came to $19.00 and they charged me $100.00. Then tells me I have to wait 3 business days to get it back!

The ONLY Positive:  It only took a few minutes to find a parking spot. Negative:  EVERYTHING else!! This was the worst visit ever!  The appetizer took forever, she didn't bring all of sauces and it wasn't right.  By the time she brought the other two sauces, we didn't even need or want it.  I had to ask for napkins, water and clean utensils!! The food took so long I asked for to go boxes!  I had to get someone to get my waitress twice because she was so darn slow and it wasn't rven crowded today.  So needless to say, I left 0$ as a tip.  I don't pay for bad customer service!  I am extremely disappointed and will never return to that location ever again.
Service was a disgrace. Food was even worse. I was so disappointed in this Friday's! Hands down the worse Friday's food and service I have ever experienced. I won't be coming back.

I tried the Beyond Burger and it was delicious!  If you ask for no cheese or "special sauce," the burger is vegan.  It was almost too realistic in the sense that I was wondering if maybe I got a real beef burger by accident!
